description_txt: stated on March 30, 2011 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Says David Prosser = Scott Walker.

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2011 in video:
quote_txt: Says the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act adopted last year contains "a series of slush funds, set up to stay on the books automatically, with little or no oversight."

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2011 in a television interview:
quote_txt: "Public sentiment in favor of collective bargaining and in favor of the unions has actually gone up as these governors, I think, have overreached and gone too far and tried to destroy the labor movement."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2011 in his book, "Courage to Stand: An American Story":
quote_txt: "Ultimately, after an exhaustive investigation," the National Transportation Safety Board concluded that a Minneapolis bridge collapsed in 2007 "because of an original design flaw dating back to the 1960s."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2011 in a web video.:
quote_txt: Says new EPA water regulations would force the state to make drainage canals every bit as clean as pristine Florida river systems.

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2011 in a YouTube video.:
quote_txt: Since Corey Stewart became chairman in November 2006, unemployment is up 150% and average home price sales are down $150,000.

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2011 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Says Jeff Stone = Scott Walker.

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2011:
quote_txt: The "House-passed budget proposal could cut funding for programs that help keep local neighborhoods safe, slash more than $1.7 million in anti-terror funds for Ohio."

description_txt: stated on February 27, 2011 in an op-ed:
quote_txt: Georgia public sector employees do not have a say in the conditions of their employment, do not have bargaining rights or a say in their working conditions.

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2011 in a speech at the Conservative Principles PAC Conference:
quote_txt: "One. That's the number of new drilling permits under the Obama administration since they came into office."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2011 in a televised address:
quote_txt: "Regime change (in Iraq) took eight years"

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2011 in an interview with Sean Hannity of Fox News:
quote_txt: "American troops have never been under the formal control of another nation."

description_txt: stated on March 25, 2011 in a letter to the editor of the "St. Petersburg Times":
quote_txt: "We don't need a separate (prescription drug) database ... Pharmacies already have a database in place."

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2011 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: As a prosecutor, Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice David Prosser did not investigate or file charges in a case involving 30-year pedophile priest, then participated in cover-up.

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Every taxpayer owes about $130,000 to pay off the national debt."

description_txt: stated on March 22, 2011 in a campaign appearance:

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2011 in a blog:
quote_txt: The hour of sleep you lose during the change to daylight saving time might initially pose some health risks.

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2011 in a newsletter:
quote_txt: "Oregon is the only state out of the 50 states in the USA that continues to pay 100% of the medical benefits for its employees and their families."

description_txt: stated on February 28, 2011 in a statement:
quote_txt: Says a Lubbock terror suspect’s alleged plan "to use baby dolls to conceal chemical explosives" is similar to a 1995 plot "to blow up 12 jumbo jets over the Pacific Ocean."

description_txt: stated on February 17, 2011 in a House committee hearing:

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2011 in a newspaper interview:
quote_txt: Says Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice David Prosser "has prejudged matters that are likely to come before the court."

description_txt: stated on March 22, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: Woonsocket needs a garbage-burning power plant because "residents are paying through the nose for electricity that’s fueled by foreign oil, at prices that are skyrocketing."

description_txt: stated on March 17, 2011 in a floor speech.:
quote_txt: Ending federal funding for National Public Radio would jeopardize 9,000 jobs.

description_txt: stated on March 15, 2011 in a press release:

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2010 in a news report:

quote_txt: On his support for sharply limiting collective bargaining by public employees.
